content.biography:
Jobst Vascular Institute is a world-renowned vascular center that provides patients access to comprehensive vascular services including: vascular testing, vascular rehabilitation, wound care, anticoagulation care, clinical trials, and specialized treatment for varicose and spider veins.
The physicians of ProMedica Physicians Jobst Vascular and Jobst Vascular Institute all are board certified in vascular disease. With 15 office locations across northwest Ohio and southeast Michigan, we are committed to providing our patients and their families with high quality, innovative, and patient-centered care.
Jihad T. Abbas, MD, is a board certified general & vascular surgeon with ProMedica Physicians Jobst Vascular, and a Clinical Associate Professor of Surgery at The University of Toledo Department of Surgery. Dr. Abbas has a special interest in aortic diseases, carotid diseases, and wound care and limb salvage.
Dr. Abbas and his wife, Kimberly, have three sons. Dr. Abbas is a graduate of The American University of Beirut, and is fluent in English, as well as, Arabic and French. He has been practicing vascular surgery in Toledo for more than 15 years. In their spare time, both Dr. and Mrs. Abbas are involved in community service and enjoy traveling abroad. He has been on the faculty at the University of Toledo for the last 18 years of his professional life.
education: Medical SchoolAmerican University of Beirut, Lebanon
ResidencyMedical College of Georgia Hospital and Clinics
ResidencyNew York University Medical Center/Bellevue Hospital
FellowshipBaylor College of Medicine

title: Shaheen Alam MD - Psychiatry - Sylvania, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Shaheen Alam MD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationAddress:
5800 Monroe St.
Suite G
Sylvania, OH 43560

content.biography:
Shaheen Alam, MD is a licensed psychiatrist. Dr. Alam is fellowship-trained in Child and Adolescent Psychiatry from the Brookdale University Hospital Medical Center in New York and received her doctorate from Tohoku University School of Medicine in Sendai, Japan.

She has had numerous articles and abstracts published in peer reviewed journals in addition to making many scientific psychiatric presentations.

Care Philosophy: Dr. Alam emphasizes the successful doctor-patient relationship, which is critical in mental health management. She also loves working in a multicultural environment, solving problems and facing challenges together with her patients.

Patients and Conditions treated: In addition to treating adults, families and individuals, Dr. Alam specializes in treating children and adolescents.

Some of the conditions she treats are: depression, anxiety, psychosis, bipolar, employee mental health, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD).

More about me: Dr. Alam enjoys spending time with her family and practicing dance. She was the National Folk Dance Champion in Bangladesh three times.
education: Medical SchoolChittagong Medical College, Chittagong, Bangladesh
ResidencyUniversity of Toledo, Toledo, Ohio
ResidencyBrookdale University Hospital Medical Center, Brooklyn, New York
FellowshipBrookdale University Hospital Medical Center, Brooklyn, New York
Doctoral StudiesTohoku University School of Medicine, Sendai, Japan

title: David Sell PA-C - Neurosurgery - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: David Sell PA-C

primaryLocation.locationAddress:
2130 W. Central Ave.
Suite 105
Toledo, OH 43606

content.biography: I grew up in a rural community in eastern Ohio but moved to Toledo for my undergraduate degree in 1996.  I chose to stay in Toledo for graduate school and have worked in brain and spine surgery all but one year of my career.  I love the challenge that Neurosurgery offers and cannot imagine working in a different specialty.  I chose to treat my patients the way that I would like to be treated and believe this helps in making personal connections and fostering trust.  Navigating the health care system can be intimidating and overwhelming, therefore I try to make the experience more pleasant for my patients. Clinically, I am interested in Normal Pressure Hydrocephalus (NPH), Cervical myelopathy, Craniosynostosis, Brain tumors, Lumbar fusion and Revision Lumbar fusion (PLIF/TLIF).  I am trained in pedicle screw placement and fixation as well as Normal Pressure Hydrocephalus (NPH).
education: Master of Science/Biomedical ScienceMedical College of Ohio, Toledo, Ohio

Care Philosophy: Dr. Alam emphasizes the successful doctor-patient relationship, which is critical in mental health management. She also loves working in a multicultural environment, solving problems and facing challenges together with her patients.

Patients and Conditions treated: In addition to treating adults, families and individuals, Dr. Alam specializes in treating children and adolescents.

Some of the conditions she treats are: depression, anxiety, psychosis, bipolar, employee mental health, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD).

More about me: Dr. Alam enjoys spending time with her family and practicing dance. She was the National Folk Dance Champion in Bangladesh three times.

content.biography:
Jobst Vascular Institute is a world-renowned vascular center that provides patients access to comprehensive vascular services including: vascular testing, vascular rehabilitation, wound care, anticoagulation care, clinical trials, and specialized treatment for varicose and spider veins.
The physicians of ProMedica Physicians Jobst Vascular and Jobst Vascular Institute all are board certified in vascular disease. With 15 office locations across northwest Ohio and southeast Michigan, we are committed to providing our patients and their families with high quality, innovative, and patient-centered care.
Jihad T. Abbas, MD, is a board certified general & vascular surgeon with ProMedica Physicians Jobst Vascular, and a Clinical Associate Professor of Surgery at The University of Toledo Department of Surgery. Dr. Abbas has a special interest in aortic diseases, carotid diseases, and wound care and limb salvage.
Dr. Abbas and his wife, Kimberly, have three sons. Dr. Abbas is a graduate of The American University of Beirut, and is fluent in English, as well as, Arabic and French. He has been practicing vascular surgery in Toledo for more than 15 years. In their spare time, both Dr. and Mrs. Abbas are involved in community service and enjoy traveling abroad. He has been on the faculty at the University of Toledo for the last 18 years of his professional life.

primaryLocation.locationAddress:
605 Third Ave.
Suite D

content.biography:
Family Medicine is all about getting patients to the healthiest version of themselves and keeping them there. Family physicians put the emphasis on the preventive therapies. They pride themselves in caring for the whole patient, not a specific organ system or problem.

Muhamid Asif, MD believes in a patient centered and family oriented care. He would like to be the key resource for his patients and empower them by providing appropriate medical information in plain English. Through education and motivational interviewing, he hopes they feel supported to make healthy decisions.

While he enjoys helping patients of all ages and treating all health conditions, Dr. Asif’s special interests include metabolic disorders including diabetes, hyperlipidemia, obesity, and medically supervised weight loss. He enjoys being hands on and offering patients procedural care in the clinic including wound care, skin biopsies, toe nail removal, long term contraception insertion/removal, diabetic foot care and lumps/bumps.On a personal level, Dr. Asif and his wife enjoy exploring whenever possible with hikes and mountain biking trails. They also love traveling and experiencing new foods and cultures.
education: Medical SchoolSaba University School of Medicine,
ResidencyWestern Michigan University, Homer Stryker School of Medicine

content.biography:
Hana J. Awada-Mitchell, CNM is a certified nurse-midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with fewer medical interventions.
Care philosophy: To Hana, midwifery is a practice of women-centered care. She believes it is her role to empower women to take an active role in their healthcare and work in partnership as she supports them through any life event. Whether it is pregnancy, childbirth, gynecologic issues, or general wellness, Hana looks to provide space where all women are felt well cared for and respected.
More about me: When Hana is not caring for women, she enjoys spending her time traveling, staying active, and being with friends and family and caring for her three girls. She is originally from Toledo/Sylvania and is excited to care for women in her community.

content.biography:
Melissa Baer, MD is a board-certified obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN).
Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.
Dr. Baer enjoys helping women through pregnancy and welcoming new life into the world, as well as assisting women with unique issues such as abnormal bleeding, pelvic pain and menopause. She loves educating patients and finds it really important for patients to have a better understanding of their body and what is normal and what is not normal. She enjoys educating patients about the issues they might be having and the risks and benefits to treatments so that patients can make educated decisions about their health care.

content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationAddress:
605 Third Ave.
Suite D
Fremont, OH 43420

content.biography:
Family Medicine is all about getting patients to the healthiest version of themselves and keeping them there. Family physicians put the emphasis on the preventive therapies. They pride themselves in caring for the whole patient, not a specific organ system or problem.

Muhamid Asif, MD believes in a patient centered and family oriented care. He would like to be the key resource for his patients and empower them by providing appropriate medical information in plain English. Through education and motivational interviewing, he hopes they feel supported to make healthy decisions.

While he enjoys helping patients of all ages and treating all health conditions, Dr. Asif’s special interests include metabolic disorders including diabetes, hyperlipidemia, obesity, and medically supervised weight loss. He enjoys being hands on and offering patients procedural care in the clinic including wound care, skin biopsies, toe nail removal, long term contraception insertion/removal, diabetic foot care and lumps/bumps.On a personal level, Dr. Asif and his wife enjoy exploring whenever possible with hikes and mountain biking trails. They also love traveling and experiencing new foods and cultures.
education: Medical SchoolSaba University School of Medicine,
ResidencyWestern Michigan University, Homer Stryker School of Medicine
Undergraduate EducationUniversity of Toronto

title: Hana J Awada-Mitchell CNM - Midwifery - Sylvania, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Hana J Awada-Mitchell CNM
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Hana J. Awada-Mitchell, CNM is a certified nurse-midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with fewer medical interventions.
Care philosophy: To Hana, midwifery is a practice of women-centered care. She believes it is her role to empower women to take an active role in their healthcare and work in partnership as she supports them through any life event. Whether it is pregnancy, childbirth, gynecologic issues, or general wellness, Hana looks to provide space where all women are felt well cared for and respected.
More about me: When Hana is not caring for women, she enjoys spending her time traveling, staying active, and being with friends and family and caring for her three girls. She is originally from Toledo/Sylvania and is excited to care for women in her community.

title: Lauren Blanchard PA-C - Vascular Surgery - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Lauren Blanchard PA-C
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography: Lauren Blanchard, PA-C, is a certified physician assistant in vascular surgery and medicine.  Vascular medicine involves the study of blood vessels outside of the heart and the lymphatic system.  Vascular medicine specialists study the diseases of the veins, arteries, and connective tissues.  Vascular surgeons provide the surgical treatment of disease in the circulatory system outside of the heart and brain.  Additionally, patients have access to vascular services including vascular testing and rehabilitation, wound care, anticoagulation care, and specialized treatment for varicose and spider veins.Lauren believes that compassionate care and individualized attention provide the foundation to build a patient-provider relationship that encompasses trust and respect.  Through the aspects of patient education, Lauren's goal is to achieve the highest-level care for the patients of Jobst Vascular Institute, working together to achieve better health and well-being.

title: Zachary Chamberlin PA-C - Cardiothoracic Surgery - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Zachary Chamberlin PA-C
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Zachary Chamberlin, PA-C, is a board-certified physician assistant who specializes in cardiothoracic surgery. Cardiothoracic surgery focuses on surgical problems related to the heart and chest cavity.

Conditions treated: Aortic valve disease, mitral valve disease, coronary artery disease, aortic dissections, lung cancer, and pneumothorax and infection.

Procedures/treatments performed: Minimally invasive procedures, endoscopic vein harvesting, pacemaker and lead extractions.Clinical interests: Cardiology and surgery.

More about me: Zachary graduated with his degree from Alderson Broaddus University in 2016 and was inducted into the Pi Alpha Honor Society upon graduation.Throughout his early life, he was always fascinated with the cardiac system and how it could be impacted by numerous variables that ultimately impact every other organ system in a person's body.
education: Master of Physician Assistant StudiesAlderson Broaddus University
Bachelor of Science in Exercise ScienceUniversity of Toledo

content.biography:
ProMedica Ear, Nose and Throat, the largest otolaryngology practice in northwest Ohio, provides comprehensive management of disorders involving the ears, nose and throat and other related structures of the head and neck region. Additionally, our physician-led team includes advance practice providers, audiologists and speech therapists. Our priority is to provide patient-centered care that is entirely focused on improving your health and well-being. We provide medical and surgical treatments for a wide range of conditions. Our approach to patient-centered care is what makes the ProMedica ENT patient experience unique.
Learn more about ear, nose and throat care at ProMedica
Dr. Charnesky is a board certified physician with the American Osteopathic Board of Ophthalmology & Otolaryngology-Head & Neck Surgery. She is an Associate Professor at the Michigan State University College of Osteopathic Medicine and the University of Toledo. She holds active memberships with the following professional societies: American Academy of Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery, American Osteopathic College of Ophthalmology and Otolaryngology Head & Neck Surgery, American Osteopathic Association, and American Academy of Otolaryngic Allergy.



Special procedures that Dr. Charnesky performs include: In-office Balloon Sinuplast and Earwells (newborn correction of auricle/ear malformations).
education: Medical SchoolMichigan State University College of Osteopathic Medicine
ResidencyBotsford Hospital
FellowshipAscension Health St. Vincent
Undergraduate EducationUniversity of Michigan

title: Brooke Cheney CNM - Midwifery - Sylvania, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Brooke Cheney CNM
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Brooke Cheney, CNM, is a board-certified nurse-midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who provide reproductive primary care and who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with few medical interventions.
Care philosophy: Brooke strives to provide holistic, high quality, safe and evidence based healthcare to people from onset of puberty and throughout their lifespan. Her primary goal is to develop therapeutic relationships to support and empower patients and their families in achieving their optimal health goals.
Clinical interests: Physiologic birth, breastfeeding support and global women’s healthcare.
More about me: Part of Brooke's midwifery training was spent working with women, children and families in Uganda, Africa in a local community hospital. In her free time, she enjoys exploring the outdoors, trying new recipes and spending time with her family.

Bachelor of Science in BiologyMichigan State University

title: Zachary Chamberlin PA-C - Cardiothoracic Surgery - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Zachary Chamberlin PA-C
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Zachary Chamberlin, PA-C, is a board-certified physician assistant who specializes in cardiothoracic surgery. Cardiothoracic surgery focuses on surgical problems related to the heart and chest cavity.

Conditions treated: Aortic valve disease, mitral valve disease, coronary artery disease, aortic dissections, lung cancer, and pneumothorax and infection.

Procedures/treatments performed: Minimally invasive procedures, endoscopic vein harvesting, pacemaker and lead extractions.Clinical interests: Cardiology and surgery.

More about me: Zachary graduated with his degree from Alderson Broaddus University in 2016 and was inducted into the Pi Alpha Honor Society upon graduation.Throughout his early life, he was always fascinated with the cardiac system and how it could be impacted by numerous variables that ultimately impact every other organ system in a person's body.
education: Master of Physician Assistant StudiesAlderson Broaddus University
Bachelor of Science in Exercise ScienceUniversity of Toledo

content.biography:
ProMedica Ear, Nose and Throat, the largest otolaryngology practice in northwest Ohio, provides comprehensive management of disorders involving the ears, nose and throat and other related structures of the head and neck region. Additionally, our physician-led team includes advance practice providers, audiologists and speech therapists. Our priority is to provide patient-centered care that is entirely focused on improving your health and well-being. We provide medical and surgical treatments for a wide range of conditions. Our approach to patient-centered care is what makes the ProMedica ENT patient experience unique.
Learn more about ear, nose and throat care at ProMedica
Dr. Charnesky is a board certified physician with the American Osteopathic Board of Ophthalmology & Otolaryngology-Head & Neck Surgery. She is an Associate Professor at the Michigan State University College of Osteopathic Medicine and the University of Toledo. She holds active memberships with the following professional societies: American Academy of Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery, American Osteopathic College of Ophthalmology and Otolaryngology Head & Neck Surgery, American Osteopathic Association, and American Academy of Otolaryngic Allergy.



Special procedures that Dr. Charnesky performs include: In-office Balloon Sinuplast and Earwells (newborn correction of auricle/ear malformations).
education: Medical SchoolMichigan State University College of Osteopathic Medicine
ResidencyBotsford Hospital
FellowshipAscension Health St. Vincent
Undergraduate EducationUniversity of Michigan

conditionsProcedures: Rib fractures and rib fracture fixation
content.biography:
I am a board certified general surgeon who specializes in trauma, critical care and emergency general surgery.

As the Director of the Level 1 Trauma program at ProMedica Toledo Hospital, a large amount of my time is spent taking care of some of the sickest patients in the hospital.

While I enjoy the challenge of caring for very sick patients, I also enjoy helping patients with more straight forward surgical problems in my elective general surgery practice.I have a faculty appointment at The University of Toledo, College of Medicine and Life Sciences as a Clinical Assistant Professor of Surgery.
education: Medical SchoolLake Erie College of Osteopathic Medicine
ResidencyOhio University/Mercy St. Vincent Medical center
FellowshipThe Ohio State University Wexner Medical Center

title: Madeleine Craig MD, MBA - Obstetrics - Perrysburg, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Madeleine Craig MD, MBA
content.location: ProMedica Physicians Obstetrics | Gynecology - Levis Commons
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Physicians Obstetrics | Gynecology - Levis Commons

content.biography:
Madeleine Craig, MD is an obstetrician/gynecologist. Obstetrics is the field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period, after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women’s health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists can also help diagnose cervical, uterine, and ovarian cancer. They treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate and counsel on contraception.

Care philosophy: Dr. Craig’s care philosophy is centered around listening and collaboration. She believes in listening to her patients’ biggest questions and concerns, reviewing the most up-to-date and pertinent treatment options a patient may have, and deciding upon a plan together.

Conditions treated: Routine and high-risk pregnancies, painful or irregular menstrual periods. Contraception, fibroids, sexual health, menopause, routine screening

Procedures performed: Minimally invasive (robotic) surgery, including hysterectomy, removal of fallopian tubes (salpingectomy) or ovaries (oophorectomy); endometrial ablation, hysteroscopy

More about me: Dr. Craig grew up all over the country, but found her home in Northwest Ohio with her husband and two golden retrievers. In her spare time, you’ll find her enjoying the great food Toledo has to offer, watching a Wolverine or Green Bay football game, or cooking a new recipe.
education: Medical SchoolUniversity of Toledo College of Medicine, Toledo, Ohio
ResidencyOBGYN, University of Toledo College of Medicine, Toledo, Ohio
Undergraduate EducationUniversity of Michigan, Ann Arbor, MI
Master of Business AdministrationUniversity of Toledo, Toledo, Ohio

title: Kevin Creedon APRN-CNP - Cardiology - Maumee, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Kevin Creedon APRN-CNP
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Kevin Creedon, CNP is a certified nurse practitioner in acute care that specializes in cardiology. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.

Kevin is certified through the American Association of Critical Care Nurses and the Ohio Board of Nursing (for both my RN and APRN). He also has his ACLS and BLS through the American Heart Association.

Care philosophy: His goal is to care for patients to his utmost ability with a compassionate mindset to provide the most appropriate and timely care. Kevin also believes in treating patients like he would treat his family. He is a relaxed individual that will not judge based on prior life choices or circumstances and will provide clinically appropriate care.

Conditions treated: Coronary artery disease, congested heart failure, arrhythmias such as atrial fibrillation, SVT, bradycardia, cardiomyopathy/congestive heart failure, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, valvular heart disease, vascular primary prevention, pulmonary hypertension, and dysautonomia/POTS.

More about me: Kevin was an ICU nurse for roughly seven years before becoming a nurse practitioner and has only been a nurse practitioner in cardiology. In addition to cardiology, he is also interested in nephrology and pulmonary.

He is from Pittsburgh, PA and enjoys sports (football, baseball, lacrosse, and hockey), especially his hometown teams.
education: Undergraduate EducationOhio University
Graduate EducationWalden University

title: Donald G Crescenzo MD, MBA - Cardiothoracic Surgery - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Donald G Crescenzo MD, MBA
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Dr. Donald Crescenzo is board-certified in thoracic surgery and general surgery. He is also a board-certified medical examiner. He treats a full range of cardiac issues. He and his fellow cardiothoracic surgeons strive to make national level care available to patients in the NW Ohio and SE Michigan so that they do not have to travel hours away from their families to receive top-notch treatment. In fact, the quality of care, outcomes and treatment they offer are consistently ranked among the top in the country by credible rating agencies and professional and trade organizations like The Society for Thoracic Surgeons.
Dr. Crescenzo is a clinical assistant professor at The University of Toledo, College of Medicine and Life Sciences.

content.name: Aleia Crim MD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
conditionsProcedures: Gynecologic Malignancies (including ovarian, uterine, cervical, and vulvar)
Management of chemotherapeutic treatment for gynecologic malignancies, including consideration for personalized genomic targeted therapy and evaluation for clinical trials
Risk reduction of hereditary gynecologic malignancies
content.biography:
Care philosophy: Dr. Crim thinks it is important to address patients’ needs with a team approach to care. With her support team and her patient’s support team working together towards a common discussed goal, we can provide excellent care and achieve amazing outcomes. It is important that the patient’s goals are always addressed and are the center of the physician/patient determined care plan.
Dr. Crim is a native of Birmingham, Alabama and fell in love with Ohio during training. She and her family are actually looking forward to true winter weather again. Dr. Crim finds humor to be an important part of forming patient relationships since laughter is the best medicine. She is a passionate advocate of women’s health care and hopes to make a difference for the women in northwest Ohio and the surrounding areas.
For full disclosure purposes, she likes her patients and families to be aware that she is a huge University of Alabama fan. Roll tide!
Special interests: Gynecologic malignancies including ovarian, uterine, cervical, and vulvar cancers. Risk reduction of hereditary gynecologic malignancies. Complex gynecologic/pelvic surgery. Particular interest in minimally invasive surgical techniques including laparoscopic and robotic approaches where appropriate. Management of chemotherapeutic treatment for gynecologic malignancies including consideration for personalized genomic targeted therapy and evaluation for clinical trials.
Conditions treated: Gynecologic malignancies including ovarian, uterine, cervical, and vulvar cancers.
Procedures performed: Robotic, laparoscopic, vaginal, and open approaches to complex pelvic surgery. Radical cytoreductive surgery in the management of gynecologic malignancies.

ResidencyOhio State University Medical Center, Columbus, Ohio

title: Kevin Creedon APRN-CNP - Cardiology - Maumee, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Kevin Creedon APRN-CNP
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Kevin Creedon, CNP is a certified nurse practitioner in acute care that specializes in cardiology. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.

Kevin is certified through the American Association of Critical Care Nurses and the Ohio Board of Nursing (for both my RN and APRN). He also has his ACLS and BLS through the American Heart Association.

Care philosophy: His goal is to care for patients to his utmost ability with a compassionate mindset to provide the most appropriate and timely care. Kevin also believes in treating patients like he would treat his family. He is a relaxed individual that will not judge based on prior life choices or circumstances and will provide clinically appropriate care.

Conditions treated: Coronary artery disease, congested heart failure, arrhythmias such as atrial fibrillation, SVT, bradycardia, cardiomyopathy/congestive heart failure, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, valvular heart disease, vascular primary prevention, pulmonary hypertension, and dysautonomia/POTS.

More about me: Kevin was an ICU nurse for roughly seven years before becoming a nurse practitioner and has only been a nurse practitioner in cardiology. In addition to cardiology, he is also interested in nephrology and pulmonary.

He is from Pittsburgh, PA and enjoys sports (football, baseball, lacrosse, and hockey), especially his hometown teams.
education: Undergraduate EducationOhio University
Graduate EducationWalden University

title: Donald G Crescenzo MD, MBA - Cardiothoracic Surgery - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Donald G Crescenzo MD, MBA
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Dr. Donald Crescenzo is board-certified in thoracic surgery and general surgery. He is also a board-certified medical examiner. He treats a full range of cardiac issues. He and his fellow cardiothoracic surgeons strive to make national level care available to patients in the NW Ohio and SE Michigan so that they do not have to travel hours away from their families to receive top-notch treatment. In fact, the quality of care, outcomes and treatment they offer are consistently ranked among the top in the country by credible rating agencies and professional and trade organizations like The Society for Thoracic Surgeons.
Dr. Crescenzo is a clinical assistant professor at The University of Toledo, College of Medicine and Life Sciences.
education: Medical SchoolGeorgetown University School of Medicine
ResidencyGeorgetown University Hospital
FellowshipGeorgetown University Medical Center
FellowshipMayo Clinic
InternshipGeorgetown University Hospital

title: ProMedica Physicians | Gynecology Oncology

content.name: Aleia Crim MD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
conditionsProcedures: Gynecologic Malignancies (including ovarian, uterine, cervical, and vulvar)
Management of chemotherapeutic treatment for gynecologic malignancies, including consideration for personalized genomic targeted therapy and evaluation for clinical trials
Risk reduction of hereditary gynecologic malignancies
content.biography:
Care philosophy: Dr. Crim thinks it is important to address patients’ needs with a team approach to care. With her support team and her patient’s support team working together towards a common discussed goal, we can provide excellent care and achieve amazing outcomes. It is important that the patient’s goals are always addressed and are the center of the physician/patient determined care plan.
Dr. Crim is a native of Birmingham, Alabama and fell in love with Ohio during training. She and her family are actually looking forward to true winter weather again. Dr. Crim finds humor to be an important part of forming patient relationships since laughter is the best medicine. She is a passionate advocate of women’s health care and hopes to make a difference for the women in northwest Ohio and the surrounding areas.
For full disclosure purposes, she likes her patients and families to be aware that she is a huge University of Alabama fan. Roll tide!
Special interests: Gynecologic malignancies including ovarian, uterine, cervical, and vulvar cancers. Risk reduction of hereditary gynecologic malignancies. Complex gynecologic/pelvic surgery. Particular interest in minimally invasive surgical techniques including laparoscopic and robotic approaches where appropriate. Management of chemotherapeutic treatment for gynecologic malignancies including consideration for personalized genomic targeted therapy and evaluation for clinical trials.
Conditions treated: Gynecologic malignancies including ovarian, uterine, cervical, and vulvar cancers.
Procedures performed: Robotic, laparoscopic, vaginal, and open approaches to complex pelvic surgery. Radical cytoreductive surgery in the management of gynecologic malignancies.

title: Robert Drenchko DO - Obstetrics - Sylvania, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Robert Drenchko DO
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Robert Drenchko, DO is a board-certified obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN). 
Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.
Care philosophy: While attending the University of Michigan, Dr. Drenchko rowed varsity crew. Being a student-athlete for four years largely inspired his philosophy of a team approach to healthcare. The patient is always the team leader and he serves to be a promotional aspect of her healthcare journey.
More about me: Dr. Drenchko was raised in Shelby Township, Michigan. His father was an OB/GYN and his mother was a figure skating instructor. When he is not practicing medicine, he enjoys staying active; training at a gym or being outdoors. He loves to spend time with his family and friends. He's also a car and motorcycle enthusiast and can often be found riding his motorcycle at local raceways.
A huge passion of Dr. Drenchko's is education. He is always working to educate himself through evidence-based literature and presentations. He is part of ProMedica's quality committee because providing exceptional evidenced based care is very important to him. He works hard to educate his patients so they can make informed decisions about their care. He also always looks forward to educating resident physicians and medical students. Dr. Drenchko is grateful and excited to be part of the new wave in promoting and optimizing women’s health care.
education: Medical SchoolLake Erie College of Osteopathic Medicine, Erie, PA
ResidencyThe University of Toledo College of Medicine and Life Sciences, Toledo, Ohio
Undergraduate EducationUniversity of Michigan, Ann Arbor, Mich.

title: ProMedica Physicians Behavioral Health Lenawee

content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Care Philosophy
Nigel Dsouza, MD, feels it is an honor and a privilege to be a psychiatrist. He believes in establishing a highly supportive environment where people in distress can be openly addressed in a collaborative fashion. Since all patients have unique backgrounds and life experiences, Dr. Dsouza emphasizes building trust, so that each patient feels comfortable in sharing their needs. His goal is to fully support his patients in their journey to self-betterment.
education: Medical SchoolAtlantic University School of Medicine, St. Lucia
Residency:  General PsychiatryEast Tennessee State University, Johnson City, Tennessee

title: Robert Drenchko DO - Obstetrics - Sylvania, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Robert Drenchko DO
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Robert Drenchko, DO is a board-certified obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN). 
Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.
Care philosophy: While attending the University of Michigan, Dr. Drenchko rowed varsity crew. Being a student-athlete for four years largely inspired his philosophy of a team approach to healthcare. The patient is always the team leader and he serves to be a promotional aspect of her healthcare journey.
More about me: Dr. Drenchko was raised in Shelby Township, Michigan. His father was an OB/GYN and his mother was a figure skating instructor. When he is not practicing medicine, he enjoys staying active; training at a gym or being outdoors. He loves to spend time with his family and friends. He's also a car and motorcycle enthusiast and can often be found riding his motorcycle at local raceways.
A huge passion of Dr. Drenchko's is education. He is always working to educate himself through evidence-based literature and presentations. He is part of ProMedica's quality committee because providing exceptional evidenced based care is very important to him. He works hard to educate his patients so they can make informed decisions about their care. He also always looks forward to educating resident physicians and medical students. Dr. Drenchko is grateful and excited to be part of the new wave in promoting and optimizing women’s health care.
education: Medical SchoolLake Erie College of Osteopathic Medicine, Erie, PA
ResidencyThe University of Toledo College of Medicine and Life Sciences, Toledo, Ohio
Undergraduate EducationUniversity of Michigan, Ann Arbor, Mich.

content.biography:
Care Philosophy
Nigel Dsouza, MD, feels it is an honor and a privilege to be a psychiatrist. He believes in establishing a highly supportive environment where people in distress can be openly addressed in a collaborative fashion. Since all patients have unique backgrounds and life experiences, Dr. Dsouza emphasizes building trust, so that each patient feels comfortable in sharing their needs. His goal is to fully support his patients in their journey to self-betterment.
education: Medical SchoolAtlantic University School of Medicine, St. Lucia
Residency:  General PsychiatryEast Tennessee State University, Johnson City, Tennessee

She began in the social work field in 2012 and has clinical experience working with children, families, and individuals. Tanya’s areas of specialty are helping adolescents and teens heal from traumatic events in their lives.

She has a certification in Trauma-Focused Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (TF-CBT) to provide trauma therapy to children. Tanya’s therapeutic approach is centered on creating a space that allows for healing, self-worth, and gaining skills to help clients achieve their goals and increase their quality of life.

content.biography: Dr. Gandert is a primary care pediatrician. As a mother of two and a person with diabetes, she believes empathy is key in partnering with parents to help every child achieve the best possible health and quality of life. Dr. Gandert is particularly interested in management of childhood chronic illness, medical education, and enhancing diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) in healthcare. She received additional training in Rural Community Health during medical school at Michigan State University and completed an additional chief year during residency at Tulane-Ochsner Pediatrics.

title: ProMedica Physicians Gynecology Oncology

content.name: Anjalika Gandhi MD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
conditionsProcedures: Gynecologic Malignancies (including ovarian, uterine, cervical, and vulvar)
Management of chemotherapeutic treatment for gynecologic malignancies, including consideration for personalized genomic targeted therapy and evaluation for clinical trials
content.biography:
Dr. Gandhi is a fellowship-trained gynecologic oncologist who treats all patients with cancers of the female reproductive tract. Her approach is to manage her whole patient, not just their cancer. She sees cancer care as a journey and wishes to be your guide and partner at every step, from meticulous surgical intervention and targeted chemotherapy or radiation to clinical trials, treatment breaks, survivorship, and/or palliative care. Your goals, support systems, resources, and identities are unique, and navigating each of these is part of a tailoring your comprehensive cancer care plan. Our extensive healthcare team will use all the tools at our disposal to achieve the best outcome for you.

A native of the Chicagoland area, Dr. Gandhi has completed her training in different parts of the country, including Pennsylvania, Ohio, Florida, and Oklahoma. This has allowed her to engage with patients of various backgrounds and belief systems and customize her clinical approach. As a woman of South Asian descent with strong family ties, she understands how ethnicity and culture can influence relationships with the healthcare system. She remains connected to her cultural heritage through Indian performing arts.

Special interests: Diversity, equity, and inclusion in healthcare; fertility-sparing surgery, targeted therapeutics, clinical trial recruitment, palliative care.
education: Medical SchoolCleveland Clinic Lerner College of Medicine of Case Western Reserve University, Cleveland, Ohio
Bachelor of ArtsUniversity of Pittsburgh, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania
Bachelor of ScienceUniversity of Pittsburgh, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania
Residency: Obstetrics and GynecologyUniversity of South Florida and Tampa General Hospital, Tampa, Florida

content.biography: Dr. Gandert is a primary care pediatrician. As a mother of two and a person with diabetes, she believes empathy is key in partnering with parents to help every child achieve the best possible health and quality of life. Dr. Gandert is particularly interested in management of childhood chronic illness, medical education, and enhancing diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) in healthcare. title: ProMedica Physicians Gynecology Oncology

content.name: Anjalika Gandhi MD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
conditionsProcedures: Gynecologic Malignancies (including ovarian, uterine, cervical, and vulvar)
Management of chemotherapeutic treatment for gynecologic malignancies, including consideration for personalized genomic targeted therapy and evaluation for clinical trials
content.biography:
Dr. Gandhi is a fellowship-trained gynecologic oncologist who treats all patients with cancers of the female reproductive tract. Her approach is to manage her whole patient, not just their cancer. She sees cancer care as a journey and wishes to be your guide and partner at every step, from meticulous surgical intervention and targeted chemotherapy or radiation to clinical trials, treatment breaks, survivorship, and/or palliative care. Your goals, support systems, resources, and identities are unique, and navigating each of these is part of a tailoring your comprehensive cancer care plan. Our extensive healthcare team will use all the tools at our disposal to achieve the best outcome for you.

A native of the Chicagoland area, Dr. Gandhi has completed her training in different parts of the country, including Pennsylvania, Ohio, Florida, and Oklahoma. This has allowed her to engage with patients of various backgrounds and belief systems and customize her clinical approach. As a woman of South Asian descent with strong family ties, she understands how ethnicity and culture can influence relationships with the healthcare system. She remains connected to her cultural heritage through Indian performing arts.

Special interests: Diversity, equity, and inclusion in healthcare; fertility-sparing surgery, targeted therapeutics, clinical trial recruitment, palliative care.
education: Medical SchoolCleveland Clinic Lerner College of Medicine of Case Western Reserve University, Cleveland, Ohio
Bachelor of ArtsUniversity of Pittsburgh, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania
Bachelor of ScienceUniversity of Pittsburgh, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania
Residency: Obstetrics and GynecologyUniversity of South Florida and Tampa General Hospital, Tampa, Florida
Fellowship: Gynecologic OncologyUniversity of Oklahoma Health Sciences Center, Oklahoma City, Oklahoma
Masters of Science, Clinical ResearchCleveland Clinic Lerner College of Medicine of Case Western Reserve University, Cleveland, Ohio
Residency Brunschwig Gynecologic Oncology RotationMemorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center, New York, New York

title: Bridget Gustwiller PT - Physical Therapy - Defiance, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Bridget Gustwiller PT
content.biography:
More About Me
I grew up in Defiance, Ohio and earned my Bachelor of Science in Physical Therapy from Bowling Green State University/Medical College of Ohio. I began my early PT career in Morristown, NJ before moving back home to Defiance focusing early on acute care and outpatient orthopedics. Over the past eight years, I have been increasing my focus in the area of pelvic floor/women's health and have definitely found that this is an area I am extremely passionate about! I am a mother of three boys and very active in our school, church, and community. I enjoy outdoor activities and camping with our family as well as spending time with my network of girlfriends supporting each other as we navigate through motherhood.
Care Philosophy
I believe in a patient centered approach to care, advocating on their behalf for their specific concerns and treatment goals. I strive to focus on patient education for better patient understanding of their condition to empower them to achieve their best outcomes with a treatment plan specifically catered for their needs.
Conditions Treated
Pregnancy and post-partum pain, chronic pelvic pain, diastasis recti, dyspareunia (painful sex), pelvic organ prolapse, stress and urge urinary incontinence, abdominal pain, constipation, fecal incontinence.
Procedures Performed:
Pelvic Floor Physical Therapy
Manual Therapy
Myofascial Release
Soft Tissue Mobilization
Patient education
Bowel/bladder education
education: Undergraduate EducationBowling Green State University

content.biography:
Rachel Haas, DO is a doctor of osteopathic medicine specializing in obstetrics / gynecology. Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born.
Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.
Care philosophy: Dr. Haas values the patient’s voice in shared decision making and believes in working together towards wellness, which is the ultimate goal.

title: Taylor Kae Hahn MA, CCC-SLP - Audiology - Sylvania, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Taylor Kae Hahn MA, CCC-SLP
content.location: ProMedica Physicians Ear, Nose and Throat - Sylvania
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Physicians Ear, Nose and Throat - Sylvania

content.biography:
Taylor Hahn, SLP is a Toledo native who has been a speech-language pathologist for 5 years. She earned her undergraduate and graduate degrees from the University of Toledo. Taylor has extensive experience evaluating and treating with adults in many settings. She has knowledge working collaboratively with individuals diagnosed with head and neck cancers, Parkinson’s Disease, Multiple Sclerosis, stroke, etc. She has helped individuals address difficulties with their speech, language, voice, or swallowing (dysphagia).

Taylor’s focus during evaluation and treatment is to put the patient’s personal goals first. Quality of life is very important to Taylor and she will do her best to incorporate an individual’s desires and wishes into treatment to achieve the best outcome possible. Speaking, being understood, and eating are abilities that are invaluable which is why Taylor will work hard to help her clients regain or manage their difficulties to the best of her ability.

Taylor is certified in the Lee Silverman Voice Treatment (LSVT) – Loud for Parkinson’s disease and Vital Stimulation for dysphagia treatment. She has experience evaluating voice and swallowing via use of fiberoptic endoscopes to determine best course of treatment for her clients. Taylor enjoys learning about best practices in her field of speech-language pathology. She was presented the award for continuing education (ACE) from the American Speech-Language Hearing Association (ACE) in 2020. Taylor will go above and beyond to research information to ensure evidence-based practice is used for everyone’s needs.

Conditions treated: Muscle tension dysphonia (MTD), vocal nodules, unilateral or bilateral vocal fold paralysis/paresis, vocal hoarseness, difficulties with eating/swallowing/choking (dysphagia), chronic cough, tracheostomy care, laryngectomy management, pre- and post-treatment management of disorders caused by head/neck cancer.
education: Undergraduate EducationUniversity of Toledo
Graduate EducationUniversity of Toledo

title: Jennifer Hughes APRN, CNM - Midwifery - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Jennifer Hughes APRN CNM
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography: Jennifer Hughes, APRN-CNM (she/her/hers) is an advanced practice registered nurse and Certified Nurse Midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who provide reproductive primary care and who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with few medical interventions.She was born and raised in Northeast Ohio. She attended The Ohio State University and received her bachelor's degree in nursing in 2016. As a nurse, she worked at the James Cancer Hospital in Columbus for over five years while completing her midwifery training. In 2021, she graduated with her master’s degree in nursing from The Ohio State University where she specialized in Nurse-Midwifery and Women’s Health.Jennifer strives to provide comprehensive, evidence-based, trauma-informed care utilizing a holistic approach. She works to support people from all backgrounds and cultural identities and their unique family structures, including LGBTQ+ affirming care. She emphasizes informed consent and seeks to empower individuals through shared-decision making throughout all aspects of her care. In labor and delivery, she aims to support individual birthing preferences and assist birthing persons in achieving low-intervention birth as desired.
education: Bachelor of Science in NursingThe Ohio State University
Master of Science in Nursing, MidwiferyThe Ohio State University

content.biography:

More about me: Leah specializes in care of adult Cystic Fibrosis patients and adult pulmonary medicine. She has lived in the Toledo area for over 25 years and has been employed by ProMedica for over 20 years.Care philosophy: Leah's care philosophy is to treat each patient as an individual and design a care plan that is unique to their needs, while maintaining their dignity.

title: Jennifer Hughes APRN, CNM - Midwifery - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Jennifer Hughes APRN CNM
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography: Jennifer Hughes, APRN-CNM (she/her/hers) is an advanced practice registered nurse and Certified Nurse Midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who provide reproductive primary care and who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with few medical interventions.She was born and raised in Northeast Ohio. She attended The Ohio State University and received her bachelor's degree in nursing in 2016. As a nurse, she worked at the James Cancer Hospital in Columbus for over five years while completing her midwifery training. In 2021, she graduated with her master’s degree in nursing from The Ohio State University where she specialized in Nurse-Midwifery and Women’s Health.Jennifer strives to provide comprehensive, evidence-based, trauma-informed care utilizing a holistic approach. She works to support people from all backgrounds and cultural identities and their unique family structures, including LGBTQ+ affirming care. She emphasizes informed consent and seeks to empower individuals through shared-decision making throughout all aspects of her care. In labor and delivery, she aims to support individual birthing preferences and assist birthing persons in achieving low-intervention birth as desired.
education: Bachelor of Science in NursingThe Ohio State University
Master of Science in Nursing, MidwiferyThe Ohio State University

content.biography:
Arshad Javed, MD, FACC specializes in cardiology. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.

Dr. Javed is board certified in internal medicine, cardiology, echocardiography, and nuclear cardiology.

Care philosophy: He believes in patient-centered care and educating his patients and their families to understand the disease process and prevention.

Conditions treated: Heart failure, valvular heart disease and other heart conditions.

Procedures/treatments performed: Echocardiography, transesophageal echocardiography, cardiac stress tests and cardiac CT scans.

More about me: Cardiovascular disease is Dr. Javed’s passion because it’s the most preventable cause of death. He likes everyday innovations in cardiology to manage heart conditions.

He loves outdoor activities, growing vegetables in his backyard, fishing, and deer hunting. He is married and has three children.

content.biography:
Ryan Jin, MD, PhD, is board-certified by the American Board of Radiology. He puts the interests of his patients first and participates in a multidisciplinary team approach that includes not just radiation treatment, but education and emotional support in a warm, healing environment. Dr. Jin believes the best patient care is delivered when the patient and physician have a good relationship, and the physician understands the goals and needs of the patient.

Dr. Jin and the ProMedica Physicians Radiation Oncology team provide exceptional cancer care close to home, with facilities located in Sylvania, Maumee, and Fremont, Ohio and Adrian and Monroe, Michigan. Services also include holistic treatment, social work, and dietary.

State-of-the-art diagnostic tests, treatments and supportive therapies: 3-D conformal radiation therapy, High Dose Rate (HDR) brachytherapy, electron radiation therapy, image-guided radiation therapy (IGRT), intensity modulated radiation therapy (IMRT), radiopharmaceuticals, stereotactic body radiation therapy (SBRT), stereotactic radiosurgery (SRS), *SpaceOAR™, Prostate Brachytherapy.

*'SpaceOAR™ Hydrogel is a trademark of Boston Scientific Corporation or its affiliates.'

content.biography:
ProMedica Ear, Nose and Throat, the largest otolaryngology practice in northwest Ohio, provides comprehensive management of disorders involving the ears, nose and throat and other related structures of the head and neck region. Additionally, our physician-led team includes advance practice providers, audiologists and speech therapists. Our priority is to provide patient-centered care that is entirely focused on improving your health and well-being. We provide medical and surgical treatments for a wide range of conditions. Our approach to patient-centered care is what makes the ProMedica ENT patient experience unique.



Dr. Jindal was born in Lima, Ohio and raised in Cincinnati, Ohio. He started his ENT practice in Toledo, Ohio in 1996 and lives in Sylvania, Ohio. Dr. Jindal enjoys seeing both adults and children patients. Outside of work he enjoys exercising, reading and travelling. Dr. Jindal's wife is also a physician and they have 2 sons.

Dr. Jindal treats all patients with respect and tried to answer the patient’s questions honestly and to the best of his knowledge. All patients are given his business card in case further questions or concerns arise.

content.biography: Mandar Joshi, MD is a board certified ophthalmologist with additional subspecialty training in the surgical and medical management of vitreoretinal diseases. He has had the pleasure of providing retinal care to patients in Ohio and Michigan for over the past 15 years. Dr. Joshi completed his undergraduate and medical school training at the University of Michigan, subsequently completing his ophthalmology residency at Tufts University and the New England Eye Center in Boston. He then completed a two year surgical retinal fellowship with the Associated Retinal Consultant and Beaumont Hospital in Royal Oak, Michigan.Dr. Joshi sees patients of all ages with diseases of the vitreous and retinal, both surgical and medical.

content.biography:
Omar Kahaly, MD is a cardiac electrophysiologist. Cardiac electrophysiology is a field within cardiology that specializes in heart conditions that cause arrhythmias such as atrial fibrillation. The specialty also encompasses heart rhythm disorders that requires pacemakers and defibrillators.

Dr. Kahaly is board-certified in clinical cardiac electrophysiology, cardiovascular disease, and internal medicine.

Conditions treated: Syncope, atrial fibrillation, pacemakers, cardiac arrhythmias, and defibrillators.

Procedures/treatments performed: Heart ablations, sudden cardiac arrest, palpitations, Watchman implantation, and pacemaker/defibrillator extraction.

More about me: Dr. Kahaly grew up in Toledo, Ohio and considers it his mission to help bring the best healthcare to the community that raised him. At ProMedica, he is active in cutting-edge clinical research.
education: Medical SchoolUniversity of Toledo College of Medicine
Fellowship: Clinical Cardiac ElectrophysiologyOhio State University Wexner Medical Center
Fellowship: Cardiovascular DiseaseOhio State University Wexner Medical Center
Residency: Internal MedicineOhio State University Wexner Medical Center
Undergraduate EducationBowling Green State University

content.biography:
Adil Karamali, MD, FACC is a cardiologist. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.

Dr. Karamali is board-certified in internal medicine and critical care.

Care philosophy: Dr. Karamali’s main goal is to keep a patient’s heart healthy. Above all, each patient must be treated as a family member with compassion and empathy. Words of wisdom from a mentor are still with him to this day: Patient First.

Clinical interests: More than the practice of general cardiology, he takes pride in his abilities as an interventional cardiologist. Additionally, Dr. Karamali has a keen interest in the care of oncology patients as it pertains to their cardiac risk secondary to their underlying malignancy.

Conditions treated: Atrial fibrillation, congestive heart failure, acute coronary syndrome, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, cardiac catheterization, transesophageal echocardiography, and cardioversion.

More about me: Dr. Karamali met his wife in college when he was a student at Boston College. She was the only one he dated there.

ProMedica Cardiothoracic Surgeon Dr. Michael Moront is a classmate of his from college.

Dr. Karamali was on the Olympic team for Pakistan for swimming, but he emigrated to the United States before he could compete. His father was in the 1948 Olympics for swimming for Pakistan.

He is an avid golfer, but is not sure what he does on the course can be called “golf”.
education: Medical SchoolAmerican University of the Caribbean
ResidencyOakwood Hospital and Medical Center
FellowshipDetroit Receiving Hospital
FellowshipProvidence Hospital and Medical Center

content.biography:
Jobst Vascular Institute is a world-renowned vascular center that provides patients access to comprehensive vascular services including: vascular testing, vascular rehabilitation, wound care, anticoagulation care, clinical trials, and specialized treatment for varicose and spider veins.
The physicians of ProMedica Physicians Jobst Vascular and Jobst Vascular Institute all are board certified in vascular disease. With 15 office locations across northwest Ohio and southeast Michigan, we are committed to providing our patients and their families with high quality, innovative, and patient-centered care.
More about Gregory Kasper MD, FACS
Dr. Kasper has been practicing vascular surgery in Toledo for more than 15 years. In 2015, Dr. Kasper was named president and chief medical officer of Jobst Vascular Institute.
Dr. Kasper was born and raised in Toledo and returned after completing his medical training. Dr. Kasper and his wife, Christina, have three sons. Both Dr. and Mrs. Kasper are active in charitable work and enjoy travel and golfing.
education: Medical SchoolUniversity of Cincinnati College of Medicine
ResidencyGood Samaritan Hospital
FellowshipEndovascular Fellowship, Arizona Heart Institute
FellowshipPeripheral Vascular Surgery Fellowship, Good Samaritan Hospital

content.biography: Danine has been a Registered Nurse within the Psychiatric Specialty for over 35+ years of her career.  She continued her education to become a Nurse Practitioner for 20+ of those years, to care for people seeking improvement in their own mental health.  As our lives change, stressors occur, and things around us evolve, Danine’s philosophy is to treat others the way she would like herself and her family to be treated for mental health issues.  We are human beings and the brain is an organ that we cannot live without and requires some special care just as other organs require.Her clinical interests have varied since each person presents a unique opportunity to meet their needs which involves other conditions, environment, strengths, and willingness to work hard and accept the help of a team of recommended resources.  Many people have pain issues, sleep concerns, loneliness to be heard, reassurance of being human and not crazy, and too many more conditions to be named.  Danine continues reading the latest research and science publications of new medications, treatments, combined treatments, and discusses with others via networks of associations with other national and international nurse practitioners and psychiatrists.She enjoys what she does, enjoys meeting the many people she has met throughout her career and looks forward to meeting many new people going forward.  Danine recognizes she do not have all the answers, not even close, but she appreciates the hard work each person has done between appointments and has taken on any hurdles or bumps along the way to improving their mental health to enjoy the moment and plan their future.  Each person that reaches their individual optimum mental health becomes a success that brings smiles, laughter, and just conversation of hard work that brightens their life and future!
education: Bachelor of Science in NursingUniversity of Detroit Mercy, Detroit, Michigan
Post-Master's Certificate: PMHNPThe Ohio State University, Columbus, Ohio
Masters in Nursing, AdministrationUniversity of Phoenix
Associate of Science, Alcohol & Substance AbuseUniversity of Detroit Mercy, Detroit, Michigan

content.biography:
Family medicine is a specialty that provides care to people of every age group. Xiaxi Layton, MD is very much a generalist, so family medicine was a great fit. I enjoy listening to my patient's stories, and getting to work with them on treatment options that would help them live their best lives. 
Having been trained in public health, Dr. Layton is an advocate in disease prevention and health education. She offers many preventative services from well child visits to a variety of cancer screenings. 
Dr. Layton was locally trained at UTMC, and completed residency at ProMedica Monroe Family Medicine Residency where she was awarded The Dana Roberts Founders Award upon graduation for emulating the caring and compassionate nature of family medicine. 
Dr. Layton would like her patients to know that she will always strive to be accessible. Whether it is struggling with smoking cessation or weight loss, she and her staff will be there to help and guide patients every step of the way.

content.biography: Danine has been a Registered Nurse within the Psychiatric Specialty for over 35+ years of her career.  She continued her education to become a Nurse Practitioner for 20+ of those years, to care for people seeking improvement in their own mental health.  As our lives change, stressors occur, and things around us evolve, Danine’s philosophy is to treat others the way she would like herself and her family to be treated for mental health issues.  We are human beings and the brain is an organ that we cannot live without and requires some special care just as other organs require.Her clinical interests have varied since each person presents a unique opportunity to meet their needs which involves other conditions, environment, strengths, and willingness to work hard and accept the help of a team of recommended resources.  Many people have pain issues, sleep concerns, loneliness to be heard, reassurance of being human and not crazy, and too many more conditions to be named.  Danine continues reading the latest research and science publications of new medications, treatments, combined treatments, and discusses with others via networks of associations with other national and international nurse practitioners and psychiatrists.She enjoys what she does, enjoys meeting the many people she has met throughout her career and looks forward to meeting many new people going forward.  Danine recognizes she do not have all the answers, not even close, but she appreciates the hard work each person has done between appointments and has taken on any hurdles or bumps along the way to improving their mental health to enjoy the moment and plan their future.  Each person that reaches their individual optimum mental health becomes a success that brings smiles, laughter, and just conversation of hard work that brightens their life and future!
education: Bachelor of Science in NursingUniversity of Detroit Mercy, Detroit, Michigan
Post-Master's Certificate: PMHNPThe Ohio State University, Columbus, Ohio
Masters in Nursing, AdministrationUniversity of Phoenix
Associate of Science, Alcohol & Substance AbuseUniversity of Detroit Mercy, Detroit, Michigan

content.biography:
Family medicine is a specialty that provides care to people of every age group. Xiaxi Layton, MD is very much a generalist, so family medicine was a great fit. I enjoy listening to my patient's stories, and getting to work with them on treatment options that would help them live their best lives. 
Having been trained in public health, Dr. Layton is an advocate in disease prevention and health education. She offers many preventative services from well child visits to a variety of cancer screenings. 
Dr. Layton was locally trained at UTMC, and completed residency at ProMedica Monroe Family Medicine Residency where she was awarded The Dana Roberts Founders Award upon graduation for emulating the caring and compassionate nature of family medicine. 
Dr. Layton would like her patients to know that she will always strive to be accessible. Whether it is struggling with smoking cessation or weight loss, she and her staff will be there to help and guide patients every step of the way.

content.name: Alisha Marchand CNM
content.location: ProMedica Physicians Obstetrics and Gynecology - Oregon
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Physicians Obstetrics and Gynecology - Oregon

content.biography:
Alisha Marchand, CNM is a certified nurse-midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who provide reproductive primary care and who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with few medical interventions.

Care philosophy: Pregnancy is not a medical condition and should not be treated as such. Pregnancy, labor and delivery are all natural occurrences and it's important to listen to one's body. Alisha believes that medical interventions should be saved for when they are required. She is passionate about treating patients holistically and providing evidence-based education and treatment techniques to ensure the best care.Clinical interests: Spinning babiesMore about me: Alisha has 13 years of experience in labor and delivery, providing support to patients and their families during labor. She believes in making decisions as a team and is supportive of any decisions that women and their family unit make prior to their arrival to labor and delivery. She believes that informed and supportive care is the only care and strives to make all patients and families feel comfortable. She also provides labor support training to staff nurses and other midwives to help decrease the rate of cesarean deliveries.
education: Undergraduate EducationOhio University
Graduate EducationUniversity of Michigan

title: Bradley Marchese MD - Family Medicine - Tecumseh, Michigan (MI)

content.name: Bradley Marchese MD
content.location: ProMedica Physicians Health Specialists of Lenawee
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Physicians Health Specialists of Lenawee

content.biography:
Family Medicine provides care for the entire family from birth, throughout adulthood, and into the last stages of life. My care philosophy is centered around my clinical interests and what I believe are the core values of family medicine which is to practice preventative medicine and help patients make life-style changes to prevent disease. It is also about treating a wide spectrum of diseases and being the first line of contact for the healthcare system. In doing this effectively I hope to gain the trust and establish great relationships with my patients.

I grew up in Columbus, OH and went to The University of Toledo College of Medicine and Life Sciences for my Master’s and Medical Degree. I then completed my residency at St. Joseph Mercy Livingston Family Medicine Residency where I was the Academic Chief Resident in my last year of residency before becoming certified by the American Board of Family Medicine.

Some interesting things that patients may not know about me would be that I have been skydiving before and I was a placekicker for John Carroll University in College. My interests include playing board games, riding bikes, personal finance, and spending time with family.

content.biography:
Family Medicine provides care for the entire family from birth, throughout adulthood, and into the last stages of life. My care philosophy is centered around my clinical interests and what I believe are the core values of family medicine which is to practice preventative medicine and help patients make life-style changes to prevent disease. It is also about treating a wide spectrum of diseases and being the first line of contact for the healthcare system. In doing this effectively I hope to gain the trust and establish great relationships with my patients.

I grew up in Columbus, OH and went to The University of Toledo College of Medicine and Life Sciences for my Master’s and Medical Degree. I then completed my residency at St. Joseph Mercy Livingston Family Medicine Residency where I was the Academic Chief Resident in my last year of residency before becoming certified by the American Board of Family Medicine.

Some interesting things that patients may not know about me would be that I have been skydiving before and I was a placekicker for John Carroll University in College. My interests include playing board games, riding bikes, personal finance, and spending time with family.

Sarah Mainzinger, CNP, is a board-certified acute care nurse practitioner specializing in cardiovascular disease.

content.biography: Paris Malin, DPM, FACFAS is board certified in foot surgery by the American Board of Foot and Ankle Surgery. She completed her 3 year surgical residency at University Hospitals Richmond Medical Center in Cleveland, Ohio, where she served as chief resident. She graduated from Ohio State University College of Podiatric Medicine. In college she dual majored in medicine and sports medicine, as well as minored in nutrition. She was a dual sport collegiate athlete and is passionate about getting athlete's back on their feet, and back in the game. She also specializes in diabetic wounds/limb salvage, foot and ankle trauma and reconstructive surgery.

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Physicians Obstetrics and Gynecology - Oregon

content.biography:
Alisha Marchand, CNM is a certified nurse-midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who provide reproductive primary care and who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with few medical interventions.

Care philosophy: Pregnancy is not a medical condition and should not be treated as such. Pregnancy, labor and delivery are all natural occurrences and it's important to listen to one's body. Alisha believes that medical interventions should be saved for when they are required. She is passionate about treating patients holistically and providing evidence-based education and treatment techniques to ensure the best care.Clinical interests: Spinning babiesMore about me: Alisha has 13 years of experience in labor and delivery, providing support to patients and their families during labor. She believes in making decisions as a team and is supportive of any decisions that women and their family unit make prior to their arrival to labor and delivery. She believes that informed and supportive care is the only care and strives to make all patients and families feel comfortable. She also provides labor support training to staff nurses and other midwives to help decrease the rate of cesarean deliveries.
education: Undergraduate EducationOhio University
Graduate EducationUniversity of Michigan

content.biography:
Ryan Meller, MSN, APRN, FNP-C, is a board-certified family nurse practitioner and has an American Academy of Nurse Practitioner Certification. He puts the interests of his patients first and believes it’s important to provide individualized, patient-focused care.

Born and raised in the Toledo, Ohio area, he and the ProMedica Physicians Radiation Oncology team provide exceptional cancer care close to home, with facilities located in Sylvania, Maumee, and Fremont, Ohio and Adrian and Monroe, Michigan. Services also include holistic treatment, social work, and dietary.

State-of-the-art diagnostic tests, treatments and supportive therapies: 3-D conformal radiation therapy, High Dose Rate (HDR) brachytherapy, electron radiation therapy, image-guided radiation therapy (IGRT), intensity modulated radiation therapy (IMRT), radiopharmaceuticals, stereotactic body radiation therapy (SBRT), stereotactic radiosurgery (SRS), *SpaceOAR™, Prostate Brachytherapy.

* 'SpaceOAR™ Hydrogel is a trademark of Boston Scientific Corporation or its affiliates.'
education: Bachelor of Science in NursingLourdes University, Sylvania, Ohio
Master of Science in NursingUniversity of Cincinnati, Cincinnati, Ohio

content.biography:
Darla Mitchell, CNM, is a certified nurse-midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with fewer medical interventions. 
As a midwife, Darla Mitchell provides care for women focusing on health, wellness, and prevention. Her goal is to use clinical expertise to empower women through health education and counseling. With this knowledge, they are able to become partners in their own care and to make personal choices which are best for themselves and their families.
She has special interests in adolescent health, lactation support and breast cancer survivorship and has been previously certified as a lactation consultant and as a childbirth educator. She has spent her entire nursing career involved in various aspects of maternal-child care; returning to graduate school to become a midwife once her own children were grown due to her passion for providing comprehensive and compassionate care for women in all stages of life.

State-of-the-art diagnostic tests, treatments and supportive therapies: 3-D conformal radiation therapy, High Dose Rate (HDR) brachytherapy, electron radiation therapy, image-guided radiation therapy (IGRT), intensity modulated radiation therapy (IMRT), radiopharmaceuticals, stereotactic body radiation therapy (SBRT), stereotactic radiosurgery (SRS), *SpaceOAR™, Prostate Brachytherapy.

content.biography:
Darla Mitchell, CNM, is a certified nurse-midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with fewer medical interventions. 
As a midwife, Darla Mitchell provides care for women focusing on health, wellness, and prevention. Her goal is to use clinical expertise to empower women through health education and counseling. With this knowledge, they are able to become partners in their own care and to make personal choices which are best for themselves and their families.
She has special interests in adolescent health, lactation support and breast cancer survivorship and has been previously certified as a lactation consultant and as a childbirth educator. She has spent her entire nursing career involved in various aspects of maternal-child care; returning to graduate school to become a midwife once her own children were grown due to her passion for providing comprehensive and compassionate care for women in all stages of life.

content.biography: Rachel is a proud graduate of The Ohio State University with a major in Nutrition. She was a registered dietitian for several years and obtained the Certified Nutrition Support Dietitian credential, allowing her to specialize in nutrition support therapies in critically ill patients. She worked at the Cleveland Clinic, Sinai Hospital of Baltimore and the University of Michigan Hospital prior to pursuing an advanced degree. Rachel was accepted into the Physician Assistant program at the University of Toledo Medical College in 2008, graduating with her Masters of Science in Biomedical Sciences in 2010. She worked for 3 years in the emergency departments of ProMedica Toledo and ProMedica Flower Hospital as well as Mercy St. Anne’s. In 2014, she transitioned to ProMedica Digestive Healthcare to better marry her love of nutrition and medicine. After 6 years of caring for her patients, Rachel accepted an opportunity to become a medical educator for Inflammatory Bowel Diseases; educating physicians, advanced practice providers, nurses, and medical assistants.
