content.biography:
Cynthia Okin, MD is a board-certified obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN).
Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.
Care philosophy: Dr. Okin believes in listening to the patient and treating the individual. In the OB/GYN specialty, she has the privilege of knowing her patients for many years.
Clinical interests: Pregnancy care, polycystic ovarian syndrome or menstrual irregularities and peri-menopause.
Special certifications: Fellow American College of OBGYN and Member of North American Menopause Society
More about me: Dr. Okin is a University of Michigan graduate, but lives in a divided household. Her husband is an Ohio State fan. One of her boys went to Ohio State and another went to the University of Michigan. Her youngest son is still at home. When she is not working, she loves watching her kids play sports. She enjoys many outdoor activities and loves to travel.

content.biography:
Cynthia Okin, MD is a board-certified obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN).
Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.
Care philosophy: Dr. Okin believes in listening to the patient and treating the individual. In the OB/GYN specialty, she has the privilege of knowing her patients for many years.
Clinical interests: Pregnancy care, polycystic ovarian syndrome or menstrual irregularities and peri-menopause.
Special certifications: Fellow American College of OBGYN and Member of North American Menopause Society
More about me: Dr. Okin is a University of Michigan graduate, but lives in a divided household. Her husband is an Ohio State fan. One of her boys went to Ohio State and another went to the University of Michigan. Her youngest son is still at home. When she is not working, she loves watching her kids play sports. She enjoys many outdoor activities and loves to travel.

content.biography:
Anthony Palmer, MD, originally from Michigan, is a pediatric hematologist/oncologist. Pediatric Hematology / Oncology is a medical specialization in the diagnosis and treatment of both blood diseases (hematology) and cancers (oncology) in children. As a member of the Children's Oncology Group (COG), Dr. Palmer has an interest in providing access, whenever possible, to clinical trials for his patients.
Care philosophy: To involve each patient's family as a key part of the medical team. No single person can cure cancer in a child. It takes many supporting members from our comprehensive care team.
Conditions treated: All childhood and young adults cancers including: acute and chronic leukemia, lymphomas, bone tumors, sarcomas, brain tumors, germ cell tumors, Wilms tumors, neuroblastoma, liver tumors. Additional conditions include ITP, aplastic anemia, neutropenia and anemia.
Procedures performed: Lumbar punctures (spinal tap), bone marrow biopsy and aspirate.

content.biography:
Jaydutt Patel, MD, is a cardiac electrophysiologist. Cardiac electrophysiology is a field within cardiology that specializes in heart conditions that cause arrhythmias such as atrial fibrillation. The specialty also encompasses heart rhythm disorders that require pacemakers and defibrillators.

Care philosophy: Dr. Patel believes that when he is with a patient, they are the center of his universe. He says that his first duty is to evaluate a patient. Second, to come up with his assessment and provide the plan based on science and data. And third, he does his best to provide recommendations with clarity, empathy and compassion.Conditions treated: Atrial fibrillation, atrial flutter, Supraventricular tachycardia (SVT), ventricular tachycardia (VT), tachy-brady arrhythmias, and congestive heart failure. Procedures performed: Catheter ablation, implantable defibrillators, implantable pacemakers, lead extraction, and watchman.  

More about me: Dr. Patel relocated to the Toledo, Ohio area with his wife and three children after practicing in Pennsylvania for 10 years.

Outside of work, he likes to spend quality time with his family and read non-fiction books. He also enjoys practicing his religion.

content.biography:
Ronak Patel, MD, is a cardiologist. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.
Dr. Patel is board-certified in general cardiology, echocardiography, and internal medicine.

Care philosophy: He encourages patients to stay as active as safely possible and take ownership of their physical well-being. He also treats patients like they’re his family.

Procedures/treatments performed: Transesophageal echocardiography, nuclear and treadmill stress testing, and echocardiography.

content.biography:
Anita Patibandla, MD is a board-certified obstetrician/gynecologist (OB-GYN).
Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born.
Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.Care philosophy: Dr. Patibandla strongly believes that women are the backbone of their family unit and communities, and when equipped with information and education about their conditions and health, they are fully capable of making the best decisions for the health and well-being of both themselves and their families. She is very passionate about providing her patients with education and learning from them.Procedures performed: Loop Electrosurgical Excision Procedure (LOOP)More about me: Dr. Patibandla is married with three children. She was a former all-American volleyball/lacrosse player at Johns Hopkins University from1994-1998.
education: Medical SchoolUniversity of Toledo Medical Center
ResidencyState University of New York- Stony Brook

title: Taylor Patterson CNP - Cardiothoracic Surgery - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Taylor Patterson CNP
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Taylor Patterson, CNP, is a certified nurse practitioner who specializes in cardiothoracic surgery. Cardiothoracic surgery focuses on surgical problems related to the heart and chest cavity.

Care philosophy: Taylor believes in treating every patient equally with evidence-based practices and sincere compassion. She also believes that you can learn a lot from your patients by taking the time to sit down and listen to them.

Conditions treated: Aortic valve disease, empyema, endocarditis, lung cancer/nodules, mitral valve disease, pneumothorax, and tricuspid valve disease.

More about me: As a cardiothoracic nurse practitioner, Taylor is primarily in charge of the care of post-op patients on the intermediate cardiac stepdown floor, including daily medication adjustments and discharge orders. She also sees patients for their follow-up appointments in the office.She started her nursing career in the heart and vascular intensive care unit (HVSICU) taking care of post-op patients. After working there for five years, she was hired as a nurse practitioner with ProMedica Physicians Cardiothoracic Surgeons.Taylor also has sisters in the medical field. Her older sister is a primary care provider (PCP) and her younger sister is a dermatologist.
education: Master of Science in NursingUniversity of Toledo
Bachelor Degree in NursingSiena Heights University

content.biography:
Timothy Phelan, MD is a cardiac electrophysiologist. Cardiac electrophysiology is a field within cardiology that specializes in heart conditions that cause arrhythmias such as atrial fibrillation. The specialty also encompasses heart rhythm disorders that requires pacemakers and defibrillators.

Dr. Phelan is board-certified in clinical cardiac electrophysiology, cardiovascular disease, and internal medicine.

Care philosophy: He believes in taking time to know his patients and to understand what is important to them. He also believes that not every treatment is the right choice for every patient.

Conditions treated: Atrial fibrillation, ventricular tachycardia (VT), supraventricular tachycardia (SVT), and cardiomyopathy.Procedures/treatments performed: Cardiac ablations, pacemaker insertion, implantable cardioverter-defibrillator insertion, and cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT/biventricular devices). 

More about me: His personal career interests include complex ablations of both atrial and ventricular arrhythmias. In addition, he often participates in various multi-center research trials designed to improve future treatments for patients.

Dr. Phelan is originally from Baltimore, Maryland where most of his early medical education took place. He met his wife while they both were pursuing their medical training in Richmond, Virginia. He and his wife have both been practicing in the Toledo area since 2017.

content.biography:
Jaydutt Patel, MD, is a cardiac electrophysiologist. Cardiac electrophysiology is a field within cardiology that specializes in heart conditions that cause arrhythmias such as atrial fibrillation. The specialty also encompasses heart rhythm disorders that require pacemakers and defibrillators.

Care philosophy: Dr. Patel believes that when he is with a patient, they are the center of his universe. He says that his first duty is to evaluate a patient. Second, to come up with his assessment and provide the plan based on science and data. And third, he does his best to provide recommendations with clarity, empathy and compassion.Conditions treated: Atrial fibrillation, atrial flutter, Supraventricular tachycardia (SVT), ventricular tachycardia (VT), tachy-brady arrhythmias, and congestive heart failure. Procedures performed: Catheter ablation, implantable defibrillators, implantable pacemakers, lead extraction, and watchman.  

More about me: Dr. Patel relocated to the Toledo, Ohio area with his wife and three children after practicing in Pennsylvania for 10 years.

Outside of work, he likes to spend quality time with his family and read non-fiction books. He also enjoys practicing his religion.

title: Lauren Regueyra, MD - Obstetrics - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Lauren Regueyra MD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Lauren Regueyra, MD, is a board-certified obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN). 
Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate. 
Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. 
More about me: Dr. Regueyra grew up in the Cincinnati, Ohio area. she returned to Toledo after spending the past several years living and working in Kansas City. In her free time, she enjoys spending time with her husband and dog, cooking, being outdoors and reading.
education: Medical SchoolUniversity of Toledo College of Medicine, Toledo, Ohio

title: Jayne M Roth CNM - Midwifery - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Jayne M Roth CNM
content.location: Maternal-Fetal Medicine at ProMedica Toledo Hospital
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationName: Maternal-Fetal Medicine at ProMedica Toledo Hospital
primaryLocation.locationAddress:
2142 N. Cove Blvd.
1st Floor
Toledo, OH 43606

content.biography:
Jayne Roth, CNM is a certified nurse-midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who provide reproductive primary care and who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with few medical interventions.
More about me: Jayne has worked in obstetrics for over 30 years. Her passion is to see women and families have healthy babies and positive pregnancy and birth experiences. Her desire is for patients and families to have compassionate caregivers who provide the best care even in less than perfect situations. Her motivation is to help other healthcare providers be better caregivers to patients. She is intrigued by high risk pregnancies, challenged by complications, and amazed that with excellent care great outcomes can occur.
education: Postgraduate EducationNurse-Midwifery and Nurse Practitioner, The Ohio State University
CertificationWomen’s Health Nurse Practitioner, Nurse-Midwife, Electronic Fetal Monitoring
Bachelor of Science in NursingUniversity of Toledo

Steven Rubin, MD, is fellowship-trained from the University of Chicago Center for Radiation Therapy and is board-certified by the American Board of Radiology. He puts the interests of his patients first and participates in a multidisciplinary team approach that includes not just radiation treatment, but education and emotional support in a warm, healing environment. Dr. Rubin believes the best patient care is delivered when the patient and physician have a good relationship, and the physician understands the goals and needs of the patient.

Dr. Rubin and the ProMedica Physicians Radiation Oncology team provide exceptional cancer care close to home, with facilities located in Sylvania, Maumee, and Fremont, Ohio and Adrian and Monroe, Michigan. Services also include holistic treatment, social work, and dietary.

content.biography:
Jennifer R. Ruddy, MD specializes in pediatric pulmonary medicine and is board certified in pediatrics and pediatric pulmonology. Pediatric pulmonary medicine is a specialty that helps children who have problems with breathing. The goal of pulmonary medicine is preventing, diagnosing, and treating diseases of the lung.
More about me: Dr. Ruddy is the co-director of the Cystic Fibrosis Center at ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital as well as a clinical associate professor of pediatrics at the University of Toledo College of Medicine. Dr. Ruddy graduated from Ohio State University College of Medicine and Public Health. She completed pediatric residency at Akron Children’s Hospital in Akron, Ohio and then completed pediatric pulmonary fellowship at Rainbow Babies & Children’s Hospital in Cleveland, Ohio. After fellowship, she practiced pediatric pulmonology at Seattle Children’s Hospital in Seattle, Washington until moving back to Ohio in 2012.   
Care Philosophy: Dr. Ruddy's care philosophy is to provide the highest quality care for children by working together as a team with the child and their family. Because each child is unique, it is important to get to know each patient well so that treatment can be based on individual needs as much as possible. She strives to provide thorough evaluation and management and provide detailed education and explanation of the condition. She encourages patients and families to ask questions, and believes that all questions are good questions. She feels that routine follow up visits are very important for many pediatric pulmonary conditions. Her goal is that by working as a team with patients and their families to provide the best care possible, they will be able to lead their lives to the fullest.

content.biography:
Jobst Vascular Institute is a world-renowned vascular center that provides patients access to comprehensive vascular services including: vascular testing, vascular rehabilitation, wound care, anticoagulation care, clinical trials, and specialized treatment for varicose and spider veins.
The physicians of ProMedica Physicians Jobst Vascular and Jobst Vascular Institute all are board certified in vascular disease. With 15 office locations across northwest Ohio and southeast Michigan, we are committed to providing our patients and their families with high quality, innovative, and patient-centered care.
More about Todd E. Russell MD, FACS
Dr. Russell is board-certified in vascular surgery. He currently serves as a faculty member of the Jobst Vascular Fellowship Program at ProMedica Toledo Hospital.
He serves as the Carotid Division Director and participates in clinical research for a variety of vascular conditions. Outside of work,  he is an outdoorsman and enjoys golf.

content.biography:
Jayne Roth, CNM is a certified nurse-midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who provide reproductive primary care and who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with few medical interventions.
More about me: Jayne has worked in obstetrics for over 30 years. Her passion is to see women and families have healthy babies and positive pregnancy and birth experiences. Her desire is for patients and families to have compassionate caregivers who provide the best care even in less than perfect situations. Her motivation is to help other healthcare providers be better caregivers to patients. She is intrigued by high risk pregnancies, challenged by complications, and amazed that with excellent care great outcomes can occur.

Mischell Schlosser, CNP is an advanced practice registered nurse and certified nurse practitioner who specializes in cardiology. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.

Care philosophy: Mischell believes in patient-centered and collaborative care. She wants her patients to understand their disease process and actively participate and take ownership of their own health. She also provides evidence-based education and treatment options to help the patient make the best decisions about their medical care.

content.location: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center

content.biography: Melissa Schlotterer holds a master’s degree in Clinical Psychology, Applied Behavior Analysis, from The Chicago School of Professional Psychology and a bachelor’s degree in Education from Kent State University. Melissa is a Board Certified Behavior Analyst with 20 years of experience teaching and supervising programs for children with autism in a variety of settings throughout Ohio, Washington D.C., and Chicago. After spending many years supervising school and home based behavioral programs in Chicago, Melissa began working for the ProMedica Finnegan Family Autism Center in 2013 and is currently the Director of Autism Programs and Services. Melissa has presented on topics related to autism and other developmental disabilities at national conferences and within different communities. Her thesis research is published in the journal, Behavioral Interventions. Melissa is originally from North West Ohio and is very passionate about being an integral part of ensuring all children within this community have access to the highest quality of services to enhance growth and learning. Melissa and her husband live in Port Clinton with their two young children. Melissa enjoys spending time with her family and friends and taking advantage of everything living on the lake has to offer.

content.biography: It is estimated 5-10% of all cancers are due to underlying hereditary causes. When we identify a person that has a hereditary predisposition to develop specific cancers, it allows for medical management tailored to that person's individual risks. It may allow for additional treatment options for one’s cancer. It is also information that can be shared with family members as they may benefit from genetic counseling and possible testing. As a Genetic Counselor, we are uniquely trained to help families understand this information and work closely with their providers to ensure they’re receiving the best possible follow-up and screening.  Rachel appreciates many people may be unsure about the genetic counseling and genetic testing process. If you have questions, she encourages you to have an initial consult with a genetic counselor so that we may address your questions and provide education regarding the options of genetic testing. Rachel looks forward to talking with you.
education: Master of Science in Medical & Molecular GeneticsIndiana University School of Medicine, Indianapolis, Indiana
Bachelor of Science Biopsychology & CognitionUniversity of Michigan, Ann Arbor, Michigan

content.biography:
Sydney Seeley, CNM, WHNP is a board-certified nurse midwife and women's health nurse practitioner. Midwives are trained professionals who provide reproductive primary care and who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with few medical interventions. 
Care philosophy: Sydney has a passion for helping and advocating for women and their families throughout their lives and through pregnancies, births, and the postpartum period. She incorporates the patient and their family’s health needs and makes them her priority. She delivers care, resources, and information to her patients and community that are designed for maximum health success. She also actively seeks to understand, inform and meet the changing health needs in her community.
More about me: Sydney was born and raised in Toledo, and is very excited to be able to guide and help women and their families throughout their lifespan.

content.biography:
Sonyoung Seo-Patel, MD is a board-certified obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN).
Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.
Care philosophy: All patients need to be heard. Dr. Seo-Patel does her very best to work with her patients to provide the care and management plan that best suits their needs and goals. She feels that longitudinal care is important. She wants to get to know her patients so that they both feel comfortable with each other especially when tackling very personal issues. The OB/GYN profession deals with very sensitive parts of the body, and she want her patients to feel respected and comfortable.
More about me: Dr. Seo-Patel was raised in New York City, but her training took her all over the country. She believes this provides her a unique and diverse perspective on patient care and also cultural sensitivity.
education: Medical SchoolSaint Louis University School of Medicine
ResidencyEmory University School of Medicine
Undergraduate EducationBarnard College

content.biography:
Joseph Sferra, MD is currently Professor and Chair, Department of Surgery at the University of Toledo College of Medicine. He is the Academic Chief of Surgery for ProMedica and serves as Surgery Service Chief, ProMedica Physicians. He is deeply involved in educating medical students and residents through hands-on surgery experiences and bedside teaching. He serves as a mentor for them throughout their education and training. He is a recipient of the Dean’s Award for Teaching Excellence 2014. He conducts clinical outcomes research.
Dr. Sferra is a practicing board-certified general surgeon with special interests in endocrine surgery, gastrointestinal surgery, surgical oncology, and complex problems in general surgery.

Dr. Sferra is a Fellow in the American College of Surgeons (ACS). He has served as President, Ohio Chapter, ACS, and Governor, ACS 2006-2012. Prior to taking on his roles at ProMedica, he served as managing partner of a 17-surgeon group.
education: Medical SchoolThe Ohio State University College of Medicine, Columbus, Ohio
ResidencyWayne State University/Detroit Medical Center, Detroit, Michigan
Undergraduate EducationDenison University, Granville, Ohio

hospitalAffiliations.hospitalName: ProMedica Charles and Virginia Hickman Hospital

content.biography:
Henry Silverman III, MD is a cardiologist. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.

Dr. Silverman is board-certified in cardiovascular diseases and internal medicine.

Care philosophy: He believes in treating each patient with great respect and intellectual honesty. He also believes in basing his recommendations on evidence/data whenever possible while taking each patient's individual situation, other medical issues, and preferences into account.Conditions treated: Cardiovascular diseases and rhythm disturbances, congenital heart disease, preventative cardiology, and follow-up care.Procedures/treatments performed: Non-invasive procedures (echocardiograms, nuclear cardiac imaging studies with exercise testing or chemical/pharmacologic stress testing, plain treadmill stress testing, and stress echo cardiograms either on treadmill or chemical/pharmacologic), Holter and event monitors and resting EKGs, diagnostic cardiac catheterizations, elective cardioversions, 3D echocardiograms and myocardial strain measurements.

More about me: Toledo, Ohio is Dr. Silverman's hometown and where he practiced cardiology from 1981 till 2004. He then joined ProMedica in Adrian, Michigan where he sees patients in the office regularly. He also performs cardiology consults in the hospital exclusively at ProMedica Charles and Virginia Hickman Hospital in Lenawee, Michigan.

Dr. Silverman has served on the Alumni Board of Governors for the Ohio State College of Medicine for the last several years. He is also a die-hard Buckeyes fan. Both he and his father attended Ohio State University Medical School and Dr. Silverman was 6 years old when he attended his father's graduation. Dr. Silverman says his father was an outstanding family practitioner in Toledo and was a great influence on him. He says he is blessed to have had him as his father and mentor.

title: Mildred (Millie) Silvestri CNM - Midwifery - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Mildred (Millie) Silvestri CNM
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography: Mildred (Millie) Silvestri, is a Certified Nurse Midwife and Women’s Health Nurse Practitioner, recently returning to the Toledo area after working as a labor and delivery nurse and training in Chicago, IL. Her love for the birth process began at a young age, hearing her mother who had nine deliveries herself, tell each child their birth story at every birthday.Her care philosophy is to treat patients the way she would her own family member, and to always listen with purpose. She is passionate about providing obstetrics and gynecologic care to patients of all ages, in all different aspects of life, and she has a strong clinical interest in making the labor process as patient centered as possible. Her doctoral research project was conducted in Chicago, IL regarding educating staff nurses on the benefits of movement and position changes in labor. Millie is excited to have returned to Toledo to serve the community she grew up in.
education: Bachelor of Science in NursingThe Ohio State University, Columbus, Ohio

content.biography:
Jobst Vascular Institute is a world-renown vascular center that provides patients access to comprehensive vascular services including: vascular testing, vascular rehabilitation, wound care, anticoagulation care, clinical trials, and specialized treatment for varicose and spider veins.
The physicians of ProMedica Physicians Jobst Vascular and Jobst Vascular Institute all are board certified in vascular disease. With 15 office locations across northwest Ohio and southeast Michigan, we are committed to providing our patients and their families with high quality, innovative, and patient-centered care. 
Richard Simman, MD, FACS, FACCWS, recently joined Monroe’s medical community after providing comprehensive plastic and reconstructive surgery in Dayton, Ohio, for 14 years. During his career, he has performed thousands of cases in both aesthetic and trauma surgery. He has additional expertise in head and neck surgery, surgical treatment of skin malignancies, and management and reconstruction of complex wounds.
Dr. Simman's skill and special interest in education and research led to his clinical professorship of plastic and reconstructive surgery, surgical dermatology, pharmacology and toxicology at Wright State University Boonshoft School of Medicine.

conditionsProcedures: Research with access to clinical trials for patients
content.biography: Kerri Simo, MD is the region’s first fellowship-trained hepatopancreatobiliary (HPB) surgeon. HPB surgery is a surgical specialty dedicated to the diagnosis and surgical treatment of both malignant and benign diseases of the liver, pancreas and gallbladder. She also has additional fellowship training in liver and kidney transplant as well as liver, biliary and pancreas surgery.Dr. Simo’s clinical interest include minimally invasive liver and pancreas surgery, microwave ablation and irreversible electroporation. She is involved on a national and international level to expand the adaptation of laparoscopic and robotic liver surgery as well as clinical trials to advance the surgical treatment of liver and pancreas cancers. Within her first year of practice here at ProMedica she established and continues to run a support group for post-Whipple patients.Dr. Simo’s hobbies include reading and running ultramarathons.

title: Robin L Smale MD - Obstetrics - Maumee, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Robin L Smale MD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationAddress:
660 Beaver Creek Circle
Suite 200
Maumee, OH 43537

content.biography:
Robin Smale, MD is a board-certified obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN).
Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.
Care philosophy: Dr. Smale believes so much of our health is preventative and up to the individual. She believes patients control so much of their own health. She wants to encourage women to take control of their health and follow preventative and evidence-based medicine standards. Her hope is for all women to have a safe place to be treated for the problems that they develop throughout their life.
Special awards/certifications: AOA Honor Medical Society, ProMedica Philanthropy Award
More about me: Dr. Smale is a local girl. She was born and educated in the area and is proud to continue to practice in this area. She has always liked to work with her hands and enjoys gardening, minor home remodeling and crafts. She also enjoys hiking, biking and kayaking in the great outdoors.
education: Medical SchoolThe University of Toledo College of Medicine
ResidencyThe University of Toledo College of Medicine

Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.
Care philosophy: Dr. Smale believes so much of our health is preventative and up to the individual. She believes patients control so much of their own health. She wants to encourage women to take control of their health and follow preventative and evidence-based medicine standards. Her hope is for all women to have a safe place to be treated for the problems that they develop throughout their life.
Special awards/certifications: AOA Honor Medical Society, ProMedica Philanthropy Award
More about me: Dr. Smale is a local girl. She was born and educated in the area and is proud to continue to practice in this area. She has always liked to work with her hands and enjoys gardening, minor home remodeling and crafts. She also enjoys hiking, biking and kayaking in the great outdoors.
education: Medical SchoolThe University of Toledo College of Medicine
ResidencyThe University of Toledo College of Medicine

content.biography: Janette Smith, CNP is a certified nurse practitioner in vascular medicine / vascular surgery. Vascular medicine involves the careful study of blood vessels outside of the heart and the lymphatic system. Vascular medicine specialists study diseases of the veins, arteries, and connective tissue. Vascular surgeons provide the surgical treatment of disease in the circulatory system outside of the heart and brain, including the arteries and veins.

content.biography: Joel Sobecki, FNP is a family nurse practitioner and has worked in family medicine since 2012. He did his last clinical rotation when he was in nurse practitioner school in Fostoria and liked it so much, he stayed there to practice, being hired three months later with Badik and Badik. Joel enjoys many aspects and specialties of the medical world, with increased interests in men’s health, infectious diseases, and psychiatric care. He believes preventive medicine is very helpful to try to find something before it becomes a problem later.Joel tries be as unbiased as he can and solve any problems in an efficient and timely manner. He thinks it is important to have honest discussions with his patients, which is sometimes very hard and delicate but it only benefits everyone involved.He is married with two little girls and enjoys spending time with them, telling dad jokes, fun trivia or little know trivia facts.

content.biography:
Dagmar T. Stein MD, PhD is a pediatric hematologist/oncologist. Pediatric Hematology / Oncology is a medical specialization in the diagnosis and treatment of both blood diseases (hematology) and cancers (oncology) in children. She has a PhD in tumor immunology
Care philosophy: Dr. Stein believes in a comprehensive team approach to support her patients through chronic illness. This team includes the patient, their parents/guardians, nursing staff, social workers, and additional specialists needed for optimal care. Communication with the patient and other care providers is important. She participates in the bi-weekly ProMedica Cancer Institute multidisciplinary clinical care conference.
Conditions treated: Bleeding and clotting disorders, blood disorders (anemia, thrombocytopenia, neutropenia), platelet function defects and menorrhagia.
Procedures performed: Bone marrow, spinal tapAwards: 
Toledo Children’s Hospital Fellow Medal, 2009Northwest Ohio Hemophilia Foundation Family Service Award, 2002More about Dr. Stein: She is married and has three grown children and one grandchild. Dr. Stein is originally from Pennsylvania, but has lived in Toledo since 1996. Her hobby is making jewelry.

content.biography: It is estimated 5-10% of all cancers are due to underlying hereditary causes. When we identify a person that has a hereditary predisposition to develop specific cancers, it allows for medical management tailored to that person’s individual risks. It may allow for additional treatment options for one’s cancer. It is also information that can be shared with family members as they may benefit from genetic counseling and possible testing. As a Genetic Counselor, we are uniquely trained to help families understand this information and work closely with their providers to ensure they’re receiving the best possible follow-up and screening.Many people have questions about the genetic counseling and genetic testing process. If you feel that you would benefit from speaking with a healthcare professional about your personal or family history of cancer, Taylor encourages you to schedule an appointment with a genetic counselor. She looks forward to answering your questions and providing education about genetic testing.
education: Master of Science in Medical & Molecular GeneticsIndiana University, Indianapolis, Indiana

content.biography: It is estimated 5-10% of all cancers are due to underlying hereditary causes. When we identify a person that has a hereditary predisposition to develop specific cancers, it allows for medical management tailored to that person’s individual risks. It may allow for additional treatment options for one’s cancer. It is also information that can be shared with family members as they may benefit from genetic counseling and possible testing. As a Genetic Counselor, we are uniquely trained to help families understand this information and work closely with their providers to ensure they’re receiving the best possible follow-up and screening.Many people have questions about the genetic counseling and genetic testing process. If you feel that you would benefit from speaking with a healthcare professional about your personal or family history of cancer, Taylor encourages you to schedule an appointment with a genetic counselor. She looks forward to answering your questions and providing education about genetic testing.
education: Master of Science in Medical & Molecular GeneticsIndiana University, Indianapolis, Indiana

content.biography:
Dagmar T. Stein MD, PhD is a pediatric hematologist/oncologist. Pediatric Hematology / Oncology is a medical specialization in the diagnosis and treatment of both blood diseases (hematology) and cancers (oncology) in children. She has a PhD in tumor immunology
Care philosophy: Dr. Stein believes in a comprehensive team approach to support her patients through chronic illness. This team includes the patient, their parents/guardians, nursing staff, social workers, and additional specialists needed for optimal care. Communication with the patient and other care providers is important. She participates in the bi-weekly ProMedica Cancer Institute multidisciplinary clinical care conference.
Conditions treated: Bleeding and clotting disorders, blood disorders (anemia, thrombocytopenia, neutropenia), platelet function defects and menorrhagia.
Procedures performed: Bone marrow, spinal tapAwards: 
Toledo Children’s Hospital Fellow Medal, 2009Northwest Ohio Hemophilia Foundation Family Service Award, 2002More about Dr. Stein: She is married and has three grown children and one grandchild. Dr. Stein is originally from Pennsylvania, but has lived in Toledo since 1996. Her hobby is making jewelry.

conditionsProcedures: Esophageal, gastric and intestinal cancers and masses

Laparoscopic and robotic hiatal hernia repair and fundoplication
Medical and surgical treatment of gastroesophageal reflux, hiatal hernias, and paraesophageal hernias
content.biography: Albert Tsang, MD, FACS is a board certified general surgeon who is dedicated to the practice of surgery. He is fellowship trained in minimally invasive surgery and advance laparoscopy. Although Dr. Tsang practices the full spectrum of general surgery, he takes special interest in the treatment of reflux, hiatal hernias, and paraesophageal hernias. He has performed over 1200 laparoscopic hiatal hernia repairs and fundoplications. Additionally, he is the only surgeon in the region to perform the laparoscopic LINX magnetic sphincter augmentation for the treatment of reflux. Since 2013, he was an early user of the Intuitive Surgical daVinci robotic surgical platform. Dr. Tsang tailors the treatment to the patient’s wants, needs, and desires. He is well versed in the use of traditional open procedures, laparoscopic, or robotic modalities to treat your condition.
education: Medical SchoolWayne State University School of Medicine, Detroit, Michigan
ResidencyThe University of Toledo Medical Center, Toledo, Ohio
FellowshipUniversity of Nebraska Medical Center, Omaha, Nebraska, in Minimally Invasive Surgery and Advanced Laparoscopy

content.biography: Tracy Tunis, F-AAA is an audiologist that specializes in patient and family centered care for the diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of hearing and balance disorders in the pediatric and adult populations. Her clinical interests include pediatric diagnostic assessments and hearing aid selection, fittings and orientations, electrophysiology and newborn hearing screenings, cochlear implants and bone anchored hearing devices, and dizziness and balance disordersTracy is dedicated to providing the highest quality of comprehensive hearing health care for her patients, their families, and communities statewide. Her mission is to integrate clinical care, education, research, and advocacy to advance the understanding and treatment of disease affecting the ear in its related structuresTracy believes patients should listen to their bodies. If you have a concern, don’t wait. Take an active role in your healthcare, communicate with your hearing healthcare provider, and don’t be afraid to ask.

content.imgAlt: Jacquelyn Van Zile MA LPCC, CDCA
content.name: Jacquelyn Van Zile MA LPCC, CDCA
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationAddress:
5800 Monroe St.
Suite G
Sylvania, OH 43560

content.biography:
Jackie Van Zile, MA, LPC, earned her Master of Arts degree from the University of Toledo and has worked in the mental health field for the past 7 years. She is a Licensed Professional Counselor (LPC) and has experience with both adults and young adults providing individual, couples, substance abuse, and group counseling in both inpatient and outpatient settings. She has worked with first responders, healthcare professionals, medical students, and persons in recovery from substance abuse.
Jackie is passionate about helping others understand and learn how to cope with anxiety, depression, trauma, life stressors, and dual diagnosis issues. She approaches treatment from a person-centered approach and encourages individuals to consider the influence of their physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual health on their overall health and well-being. She uses strength based, cognitive behavioral, motivational interviewing, solution-focused and mindfulness/grounding techniques to help empower individuals to reach their goals and achieve a sense of balance and wellness in their lives.
Jackie currently serves as the Education Chair and Board Member for the Employee Assistance Professional Association (EAPA) of Greater Toledo. She also serves as Secretary for a local non-profit supporting youth in the community.
education: Bachelor of Arts, PsychologyUniversity of Toledo
Master of Arts, Counselor EducationUniversity of Toledo

5800 Monroe St.
Suite G

content.biography:
Jackie Van Zile, MA, LPC, earned her Master of Arts degree from the University of Toledo and has worked in the mental health field for the past 7 years. She is a Licensed Professional Counselor (LPC) and has experience with both adults and young adults providing individual, couples, substance abuse, and group counseling in both inpatient and outpatient settings. She has worked with first responders, healthcare professionals, medical students, and persons in recovery from substance abuse.
Jackie is passionate about helping others understand and learn how to cope with anxiety, depression, trauma, life stressors, and dual diagnosis issues. She approaches treatment from a person-centered approach and encourages individuals to consider the influence of their physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual health on their overall health and well-being. She uses strength based, cognitive behavioral, motivational interviewing, solution-focused and mindfulness/grounding techniques to help empower individuals to reach their goals and achieve a sense of balance and wellness in their lives.
Jackie currently serves as the Education Chair and Board Member for the Employee Assistance Professional Association (EAPA) of Greater Toledo. She also serves as Secretary for a local non-profit supporting youth in the community.
education: Bachelor of Arts, PsychologyUniversity of Toledo
Master of Arts, Counselor EducationUniversity of Toledo

content.name: Albert Tsang MD FACS
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
conditionsProcedures: Esophageal, gastric and intestinal cancers and masses
Laparoscopic and robotic abdominal wall hernia repair
Laparoscopic and robotic hiatal hernia repair and fundoplication
Medical and surgical treatment of gastroesophageal reflux, hiatal hernias, and paraesophageal hernias
content.biography: Albert Tsang, MD, FACS is a board certified general surgeon who is dedicated to the practice of surgery. He is fellowship trained in minimally invasive surgery and advance laparoscopy. Although Dr. Tsang practices the full spectrum of general surgery, he takes special interest in the treatment of reflux, hiatal hernias, and paraesophageal hernias. He has performed over 1200 laparoscopic hiatal hernia repairs and fundoplications. Additionally, he is the only surgeon in the region to perform the laparoscopic LINX magnetic sphincter augmentation for the treatment of reflux. Since 2013, he was an early user of the Intuitive Surgical daVinci robotic surgical platform. Dr. Tsang tailors the treatment to the patient’s wants, needs, and desires. He is well versed in the use of traditional open procedures, laparoscopic, or robotic modalities to treat your condition.
education: Medical SchoolWayne State University School of Medicine, Detroit, Michigan
ResidencyThe University of Toledo Medical Center, Toledo, Ohio
FellowshipUniversity of Nebraska Medical Center, Omaha, Nebraska, in Minimally Invasive Surgery and Advanced Laparoscopy

content.biography: Tracy Tunis, F-AAA is an audiologist that specializes in patient and family centered care for the diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of hearing and balance disorders in the pediatric and adult populations. Her clinical interests include pediatric diagnostic assessments and hearing aid selection, fittings and orientations, electrophysiology and newborn hearing screenings, cochlear implants and bone anchored hearing devices, and dizziness and balance disordersTracy is dedicated to providing the highest quality of comprehensive hearing health care for her patients, their families, and communities statewide. Her mission is to integrate clinical care, education, research, and advocacy to advance the understanding and treatment of disease affecting the ear in its related structuresTracy believes patients should listen to their bodies. If you have a concern, don’t wait. Take an active role in your healthcare, communicate with your hearing healthcare provider, and don’t be afraid to ask.

content.biography: Natalie Walkup, PA-C, PhD, IF is a certified Physician’s Assistant in Gynecology Oncology and has been working in woman’s health since 2007. She has always had a passion for women’s health and health education and disease prevention. Natalie earned a master’s in physician assistant studies from Duquesne University and completed a doctorate program in health education with a focus on sexual health and gerontology. She is also a founder of and participating member in the ProMedica Cancer Institute Women's Sexual Health program.She understands the importance of really listening to patient’s needs and concerns and strives to provide excellent care to all of her patients. Natalie collaborates regularly with other specialists to treat the “whole” person and it’s important to her that, as a healthcare system, women are supported throughout their life span and treated in a holistic approach.
education: Bachelor of Arts, Health SciencesDuquesne University, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania
Master of Arts, Physician Assistant StudiesDuquesne University, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania

content.biography:
Adam Walter, MD, is passionate about women’s health and working to improve the quality and options for care in gynecologic oncology.  He is fellowship-trained in gynecology oncology and OB-GYN and serves as the medical director of the ProMedica Cancer Institute.

Conditions treated: ovarian cancer, uterine cancer, cervical cancer, vulvar cancer
I enjoy spending time with my wife and 3 kids. In the winter, skiing and visiting family in Colorado soak up my free time. In the summer months, I enjoy many outdoor activities here in Ohio; cycling, hiking, swimming and vacationing with family. Participating in many of our local cancer organizations’ fund raising events and survivor appreciations really allow for connection to our local cancer community.

Tanya Watson, DO is a doctor of osteopathic medicine specializing in obstetrics / gynecology.
Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.
Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born.

content.biography: Natalie Walkup, PA-C, PhD, IF is a certified Physician’s Assistant in Gynecology Oncology and has been working in woman’s health since 2007. She has always had a passion for women’s health and health education and disease prevention. Natalie earned a master’s in physician assistant studies from Duquesne University and completed a doctorate program in health education with a focus on sexual health and gerontology. She is also a founder of and participating member in the ProMedica Cancer Institute Women's Sexual Health program.She understands the importance of really listening to patient’s needs and concerns and strives to provide excellent care to all of her patients. Natalie collaborates regularly with other specialists to treat the “whole” person and it’s important to her that, as a healthcare system, women are supported throughout their life span and treated in a holistic approach.

content.biography:
Adam Walter, MD, is passionate about women’s health and working to improve the quality and options for care in gynecologic oncology.  He is fellowship-trained in gynecology oncology and OB-GYN and serves as the medical director of the ProMedica Cancer Institute.

Conditions treated: ovarian cancer, uterine cancer, cervical cancer, vulvar cancer
I enjoy spending time with my wife and 3 kids. In the winter, skiing and visiting family in Colorado soak up my free time. In the summer months, I enjoy many outdoor activities here in Ohio; cycling, hiking, swimming and vacationing with family. Participating in many of our local cancer organizations’ fund raising events and survivor appreciations really allow for connection to our local cancer community.

content.biography:
Tanya Watson, DO is a doctor of osteopathic medicine specializing in obstetrics / gynecology.
Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.
Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born.
